meanings.definition: A long, flat piece of timber, thicker than a board.
meanings.sent1: The carpenter placed a sturdy plank across the stream.
meanings.sent2: The workers used planks to build the new deck.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel balanced on the plank like a tightrope walker.
meanings.sent4: In the game of life, we all walk our own planks of destiny.
meanings.sent5: The pirate ship's plank creaked ominously underfoot.

meanings.definition: A fundamental point of a political or other program.
meanings.sent1: The candidate emphasized his main plank of lowering taxes.
meanings.sent2: The plank of equality was central to the civil rights movement.
meanings.sent3: The plank of mandatory ice cream Fridays was met with mixed reactions.
meanings.sent4: The plank of unity held the diverse group together.
meanings.sent5: The plank of honesty is crucial in any leadership role.

meanings.definition: To cover or provide with planks.
meanings.sent1: The workers will plank the entire floor with new wood.
meanings.sent2: They decided to plank the walls for extra insulation.
meanings.sent3: The prankster tried to plank his friend's car with wooden boards.
meanings.sent4: She wanted to plank the ceiling to give the room a rustic look.
meanings.sent5: The old barn was beautifully planked with reclaimed wood.
